org.numenta.nupic.network

Class Layer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.network.Layer<T>

  • public class Layer<T>
extends java.lang.Object

    Implementation of the biological layer of a region in the neocortex. Here, a Layer contains the physical structure (columns, cells, dendrites etc) shared by a sequence of algorithms which serve to implement the predictive inferencing present in this, the allegory to its biological equivalent.

    COMPOSITION: A Layer is constructed with Parameters which configure the behavior of most of the key algorithms a Layer may contain. It is also optionally constructed with each of the algorithms in turn. A Layer that includes an Encoder is always initially configured with a MultiEncoder. The child encoders contained within the MultiEncoder are configured from the Map included with the specified Parameters, keyed by Parameters.KEY#FIELD_ENCODING_MAP.

    A field encoding map consists of one map for each of the fields to be encoded. Each individual map in the field encoding map contains the typical Encoder parameters, plus a few "meta" parameters needed to describe the field and its data type as follows: 

          Map<String, Map<String, Object>> fieldEncodings = new HashMap<>();
      
      Map<String, Object> inner = new HashMap<>();
      inner.put("n", n);
      inner.put("w", w);
      inner.put("minVal", min);
      inner.put("maxVal", max);
      inner.put("radius", radius);
      inner.put("resolution", resolution);
      inner.put("periodic", periodic);
      inner.put("clip", clip);
      inner.put("forced", forced);
      // These are meta info to aid in Encoder construction
      inner.put("fieldName", fieldName);
      inner.put("fieldType", fieldType); (see FieldMetaType for type examples)
      inner.put("encoderType", encoderType); (i.e. ScalarEncoder, SDRCategoryEncoder, DateEncoder...etc.)
      
      Map<String, Object> inner2 = new HashMap<>();
      inner.put("n", n);
      inner.put("w", w);
      inner.put("minVal", min);
      inner.put("maxVal", max);
      inner.put("radius", radius);
      inner.put("resolution", resolution);
      inner.put("periodic", periodic);
      inner.put("clip", clip);
      inner.put("forced", forced);
      // These are meta info to aid in Encoder construction
      inner.put("fieldName", fieldName);
      inner.put("fieldType", fieldType); (see FieldMetaType for type examples)
      inner.put("encoderType", encoderType); (i.e. ScalarEncoder, SDRCategoryEncoder, DateEncoder...etc.)
      
      fieldEncodings.put("consumption", inner);  // Where "consumption" is an example field name (field name is "generic" in above code)
      fieldEncodings.put("temperature", inner2);
      
      Parameters p = Parameters.getDefaultParameters();
      p.setParameterByKey(KEY.FIELD_ENCODING_MAP, fieldEncodings);
    For an example of how to create the field encodings map in a reusable way, see NetworkTestHarness and its usage within the LayerTest class.

    The following is an example of Layer construction with everything included (i.e. Sensor, SpatialPooler, TemporalMemory, CLAClassifier, Anomaly (computer)) 

     // See the test harness for more information
 Parameters p = NetworkTestHarness.getParameters();
 
 // How to merge (union) two Parameters objects. This one merges
 // the Encoder parameters into default parameters.
 p = p.union(NetworkTestHarness.getHotGymTestEncoderParams());
 
 // You can overwrite parameters as needed like this
 p.setParameterByKey(KEY.RANDOM, new MersenneTwister(42));
 p.setParameterByKey(KEY.COLUMN_DIMENSIONS, new int[] { 2048 });
 p.setParameterByKey(KEY.POTENTIAL_RADIUS, 200);
 p.setParameterByKey(KEY.INHIBITION_RADIUS, 50);
 p.setParameterByKey(KEY.GLOBAL_INHIBITIONS, true);
 
 Map<String, Object> params = new HashMap<>();
 params.put(KEY_MODE, Mode.PURE);
 params.put(KEY_WINDOW_SIZE, 3);
 params.put(KEY_USE_MOVING_AVG, true);
 Anomaly anomalyComputer = Anomaly.create(params);
 
 Layer<?> l = Network.createLayer("TestLayer", p).alterParameter(KEY.AUTO_CLASSIFY, true).add(anomalyComputer).add(new TemporalMemory()).add(new SpatialPooler())
                 .add(Sensor.create(FileSensor::create, SensorParams.create(Keys::path, "", ResourceLocator.path("rec-center-hourly-small.csv"))));
    Author:
    David Ray

      Processes a single element, sending the specified input up the configured chain of algorithms or components within this Layer; resulting in any Subscribers or Observers being notified of results corresponding to the specified input (unless a SpatialPooler "primer delay" has been configured).

      Stores a NamedTuple which contains the input values and bucket information - keyed to the encoded field name so that a classifier can retrieve it later on in the processing sequence.

      • Layer

        public Layer(Parameters params,
             MultiEncoder e,
             SpatialPooler sp,
             TemporalMemory tm,
             java.lang.Boolean autoCreateClassifiers,
             Anomaly a)
        Creates a new Layer initialized with the specified algorithmic components.
        Parameters:
        params - A Parameters object containing configurations for a SpatialPooler, TemporalMemory, and Encoder (all or none may be used).
        e - (optional) The Network API only uses a MultiEncoder at the top level because of its ability to delegate to child encoders.
        sp - (optional) SpatialPooler
        tm - (optional) TemporalMemory
        autoCreateClassifiers - (optional) Indicates that the Parameters object contains the configurations necessary to create the required encoders.
        a - (optional) An Anomaly computer.

      • calculateInputWidth

        private int calculateInputWidth()

      • inferInputDimensions

        public int[] inferInputDimensions(int inputWidth,
                                  int numColumnDims)
        Given an input field width and Spatial Pooler dimensionality; this method will return an array of dimension sizes whose number is equal to the number of column dimensions. The sum of the returned dimensions will be equal to the flat input field width specified. This method should be called when a disparity in dimensionality between the input field and the number of column dimensions is detected. Otherwise if the input field dimensionality is correctly specified, this method should not be used.
        Parameters:
        inputWidth - the flat input width of an Encoder's output or the vector used as input to the SpatialPooler
        numColumnDims - a number specifying the number of column dimensions that should be returned.
        Returns:

        public Layer<T> using(Connections c)

        Returns:
        this Layer instance (in fluent-style)

      • using

        public Layer<T> using(Parameters p)
        Allows the user to specify the Parameters object used by this Layer. If the intent is to share Parameters across multiple Layers, it must be kept in mind that two Layers containing the same algorithm may require specification of locally different parameter settings. In this case, one could use #alterParameter(KEY, Object) method to change a local setting without impacting the same setting in the source parameters object. This is made possible because the #alterParameter(KEY, Object) method first makes a local copy of the Parameters object, then modifies the specified parameter.
        Parameters:
        p -
        Returns:

      • add

        public Layer<T> add(<any> func)
        Adds a "generic" processing node into this Layer's processing chain. NOTE: When adding a generic node, the order of calls to the addXXX() methods becomes crucially important. Make sure you have added items in a valid order in your "fluent" add call declarations.
        Parameters:
        func - a Func1 function to be performed at the point of insertion within the Layer's declaration.
        Returns:

      • alterParameter

        public Layer<T> alterParameter(Parameters.KEY key,
                               java.lang.Object value)
        Adds the ability to alter a given parameter in place during a fluent creation statement. This Layer's Parameters object is copied and then the specified key/value pair are set on the internal copy. This call does not affect the original Parameters object so that local modifications may be made without having to reset them afterward for subsequent use with another network structure.
        Parameters:
        key -
        value -
        Returns:

      • getSensor

      • getConnections

        public Connections getConnections()

      • compute

        public void compute(T t)
        Processes a single element, sending the specified input up the configured chain of algorithms or components within this Layer; resulting in any Subscribers or Observers being notified of results corresponding to the specified input (unless a SpatialPooler "primer delay" has been configured). The first input to the Layer invokes a method to resolve the transformer at the bottom of the input chain, therefore the "type" (<T>) of the input cannot be changed once this method is called for the first time.
        Parameters:
        t - the input object who's type is generic.

      • halt

      • isLearn

        public boolean isLearn()
        Returns the learning mode setting.
        Returns:

      • start

        public void start()
        Completes the dispatch chain of algorithm Observables with specialized Transformers for each algorithm contained within this Layer. This method then starts the output stream processing of its Sensor in a separate Thread (if it exists) - logging this event. Calling this method sets a flag on the underlying Sensor marking it as "Terminal" meaning that it cannot be restarted and its output stream cannot be accessed again.

      • getFeedForwardActiveColumns

        public int[] getFeedForwardActiveColumns()

      • getAllValues

        public <V> V[] getAllValues(java.lang.String field,
                            int step)
        Returns the values submitted to this Layer in an array whose indexes correspond to the indexes of probabilities returned when calling getAllPredictions(String, int).
        Parameters:
        field - The field name of the required prediction
        step - The step for the required prediction
        Returns:

      • getAllPredictions

        public double[] getAllPredictions(java.lang.String field,
                                  int step)
        Returns a double[] containing a prediction confidence measure for each bucket (unique entry as determined by an encoder). In order to relate the probability to an actual value, call getAllValues(String, int) which returns an array containing the actual values submitted to this Layer - the indexes of each probability will match the index of each actual value entered.
        Parameters:
        field - The field name of the required prediction
        step - The step for the required prediction
        Returns:

                                  int step)

        Called internally to propagate the specified Exception up the network hierarchy

      • getMask

        byte getMask()

        Returns the content mask used to indicate what algorithm contents this Layer has. This is used to determine whether the Inference object passed between layers should share values.

        If any algorithms are repeated then Inferences will NOT be shared between layers. Regions NEVER share Inferences

        Returns:

      • initializeMask

        private void initializeMask()
        Initializes the algorithm content mask used for detection of repeated algorithms among Layers in a Region. see getMask() for more information.

      • dispatchCompleted

        private boolean dispatchCompleted()
        Returns a flag indicating whether we've connected the first observable in the sequence (which lazily does the input type of <T> to Inference transformation) to the Observables connecting the rest of the algorithm components.
        Returns:
        flag indicating all observables connected. True if so, false if not

      • completeDispatch

        private void completeDispatch(T t)
        Connects the first observable which does the transformation of input types, to the rest of the sequence - then clears the helper map and sets it to null.
        Parameters:
        t -

      • createDispatchMap

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<T>,<any>> createDispatchMap()
        We cannot create the Observable sequence all at once because the first step is to transform the input type to the type the rest of the sequence uses (Observable<Inference>). This can only happen during the actual call to compute(Object) which presents the input type - so we create a map of all types of expected inputs, and then connect the sequence at execution time; being careful to only incur the cost of sequence assembly on the first call to compute(Object). After the first call, we dispose of this map and its contents.
        Returns:
        the map of input types to Transformer

      • mapEncoderBuckets

        private <any> mapEncoderBuckets(<any> sequence)
        If this Layer has a Sensor, map its encoder's buckets
        Parameters:
        sequence -
        Returns:

      • resolveObservableSequence

        private <any> resolveObservableSequence(T t)
        This method is necessary to be able to retrieve the mapped Observable types to input types or their subclasses if any.
        Parameters:
        t - the input type. The "expected" types are:
        • Map
        • ManualInput
        • String[]
        • int[]
        or their subclasses.
        Returns:
        an Observable suitable for subscribing or operating on.

                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> encoderInputMap)
